citation.article-title: Aeromonas allosaccharophila sp. nov., a new mesophilic member of the genus Aeromonas.

p.s: Description of Aeromonas allosaccharophila sp. nov.
Aeromonas allosaccharophila (a.lo.sa.ca.ro'phi.la. Gr.adj. allos: different; Gr.n. saccharo, sugar; Gr.adj. philos, loving; M L. adj. allosaccharophila, different-sugar-loving)

Cells are Gram-negative, straight bacilli and motile: a diffusible brown pigment is not produced: chemoorganotrophic, with both oxidative and fermentative metabolism; reduces nitrate to nitrite; oxidase and catalase positive; growth occurs in 0-3% (w/v) NaCl; resistant to 2,4-diamino-6,7-diisopropylpteridine (vibriostatic agent O/129); acid and gas are produced from glucose; lysine is decarboxylated (Moeller's medium); indole and β-galactosidase are positive; H2S from thiosulphate and Voges-Proskauer are negative; growth occurs at 4-42°C, and also at pH 9.0, but not at pH 4.5; acid is produced from sucrose, D-cellobiose, maltose, D-trehalose, D-galactose, D-mannose, glycerol, and D-mannitol, but not from adonitol, salicin, arbutin, D-xylose, lactose, m-erythritoi, duicitol, m-inositol, or D-sorbitol; sole carbon and energy sources include L-arabinose, sucrose, D-cellobiose, maltose, otrehalose, D-galactose, D-mannose, glycerol, D-mannitol, L-histidine, L-arginine, L-proline, L-glutamate, D-gluconate, fumarate and succinate; no growth occurs on salicin, lactose, m-erythritol, dulcitol, m-inositol, ethanol, L-citruiline, L-leucine, L-alanine, glycine, L-serine, L-glutamine, DL-3-hydroxybutyrate, propionate, γ-aminobutyrate, D-glucuronate, α-ketoglutarate, or putrescine; gelatin, casein, egg-yolk, Tween-80, starch and DNA are degraded, but not urea, sodium dodecyl sulphate or elastin.

It is susceptible to gentamicin (10 mg/l), nitrofurantoin (10 mg/l), polymyxin B (300 IU), oxolinic (10 mg/l) and nalidixic (50 mg/l) acids, chloramphenicol (25 mg/l), kanamycin (50 mg/l), fosfomicin (50 mg/l), erythromycin (15 mg/l), and rifampicin (30 mg/l), but not to ampicillin (50 mg/l), trimethropim (25 mg/l), sulfadimethoxine (12 mg/l) or streptomycin (25 mg/l).

It was isolated from diseased elvers of an eel-farm located in Valencia (Spain) and from diarrhoeic stools of a female patient in South Carolina (U.S.A.).
The G + C content of strain CECT 4199 is 59.5%.
The type strain is CECT 4199 (= strain 289).
